stanza.line: As the diall hand tells o’er the ſame hours it had before
Still beginning and ending / circular account ſtill lending
So moſt mighty Q. we pray / like the diall day by day
You may lead the seaſons on / making new when old are gon.
That the babe which now is youg / & hathe yet no uſe of tongue
Many a Shrouetide here may bow / to that empress I do now
That theſe children of theſe lords / ſitting at your council boards
May be grave and ag√®d seen / of her that was their fathers’ Queen.
Once I wiſh this wiſh again, / heauen ſubscribe it with amen.
